channel.title: CVE Feed for Cloud Foundry -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Cloud Foundry -- all products

item.title: CVE-2018-1265|2024-08-05T03:51:48.991Z -- cloud%20foundry -- diego
item.description: Cloud Foundry Diego, release versions prior to 2.8.0, does not properly sanitize file paths in tar and zip files headers. A remote attacker with CF admin privileges can upload a malicious buildpack that will allow a complete takeover of a Diego Cell VM and access to all apps running on that Diego Cell.

item.title: CVE-2018-15797|2024-08-05T10:01:54.595Z -- cloud%20foundry -- nfs%20volume%20release
item.description: Cloud Foundry NFS volume release, 1.2.x prior to 1.2.5, 1.5.x prior to 1.5.4, 1.7.x prior to 1.7.3, logs the cf admin username and password when running the nfsbrokerpush BOSH deploy errand. A remote authenticated user with access to BOSH can obtain the admin credentials for the Cloud Foundry Platform through the logs of the NFS volume deploy errand.

item.title: CVE-2018-1277|2024-08-05T03:59:37.663Z -- cloud%20foundry -- garden-runc
item.description: Cloud Foundry Garden-runC, versions prior to 1.13.0, does not correctly enforce disc quotas for Docker image layers. A remote authenticated user may push an app with a malicious Docker image that will consume more space on a Diego cell than allocated in their quota, potentially causing a DoS against the cell.

item.title: CVE-2018-15761|2024-08-05T10:01:54.594Z -- cloud%20foundry -- uaa
item.description: Cloud Foundry UAA release, versions prior to v64.0, and UAA, versions prior to 4.23.0, contains a validation error which allows for privilege escalation. A remote authenticated user may modify the url and content of a consent page to gain a token with arbitrary scopes that escalates their privileges.

item.title: CVE-2018-15800|2024-08-05T10:01:54.612Z -- cloud%20foundry -- bits%20service%20release
item.description: Cloud Foundry Bits Service, versions prior to 2.18.0, includes an information disclosure vulnerability. A remote malicious user may execute a timing attack to brute-force the signing key, allowing them complete read and write access to the the Bits Service storage.

item.title: CVE-2018-1191|2024-08-05T03:51:48.898Z -- cloud%20foundry -- garden-runc
item.description: Cloud Foundry Garden-runC, versions prior to 1.11.0, contains an information exposure vulnerability. A user with access to Garden logs may be able to obtain leaked credentials and perform authenticated actions using those credentials.

item.title: CVE-2018-11082|2024-08-05T07:54:36.570Z -- cloud%20foundry -- uaa%20release
item.description: Cloud Foundry UAA, all versions prior to 4.20.0 and Cloud Foundry UAA Release, all versions prior to 61.0, allows brute forcing of MFA codes. A remote unauthenticated malicious user in possession of a valid username and password can brute force MFA to login as the targeted user.

item.title: CVE-2018-11083|2024-08-05T07:54:36.539Z -- cloud%20foundry -- bosh
item.description: Cloud Foundry BOSH, versions v264 prior to v264.14.0 and v265 prior to v265.7.0 and v266 prior to v266.8.0 and v267 prior to v267.2.0, allows refresh tokens to be as access tokens when using UAA for authentication. A remote attacker with an admin refresh token given by UAA can be used to access BOSH resources without obtaining an access token, even if their user no longer has access to those resources.

item.title: CVE-2018-1262|2024-08-05T03:51:49.178Z -- cloud%20foundry -- cloudfoundry%20uaa
item.description: Cloud Foundry Foundation UAA, versions 4.12.X and 4.13.X, introduced a feature which could allow privilege escalation across identity zones for clients performing offline validation. A zone administrator could configure their zone to issue tokens which impersonate another zone, granting up to admin privileges in the impersonated zone for clients performing offline token validation.

item.title: CVE-2018-11047|2024-08-05T07:54:36.497Z -- cloud%20foundry -- cloud%20foundry%20uaa
item.description: Cloud Foundry UAA, versions 4.19 prior to 4.19.2 and 4.12 prior to 4.12.4 and 4.10 prior to 4.10.2 and 4.7 prior to 4.7.6 and 4.5 prior to 4.5.7, incorrectly authorizes requests to admin endpoints by accepting a valid refresh token in lieu of an access token. Refresh tokens by design have a longer expiration time than access tokens, allowing the possessor of a refresh token to authenticate longer than expected. This affects the administrative endpoints of the UAA. i.e. /Users, /Groups, etc. However, if the user has been deleted or had groups removed, or the client was deleted, the refresh token will no longer be valid.

item.title: CVE-2018-1269|2024-08-05T03:51:49.045Z -- cloud%20foundry -- loggregator
item.description: Cloud Foundry Loggregator, versions 89.x prior to 89.5 or 96.x prior to 96.1 or 99.x prior to 99.1 or 101.x prior to 101.9 or 102.x prior to 102.2, does not handle errors thrown while constructing certain http requests. A remote authenticated user may construct malicious requests to cause the traffic controller to leave dangling TCP connections, which could cause denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2018-1276|2024-08-05T03:59:37.640Z -- cloud%20foundry -- windows2012r2%20stemcell
item.description: Windows 2012R2 stemcells, versions prior to 1200.17, contain an information exposure vulnerability on vSphere. A remote user with the ability to push apps can execute crafted commands to read the IaaS metadata from the VM, which may contain BOSH credentials.

item.title: CVE-2018-15754|2024-08-05T10:01:54.626Z -- cloud%20foundry -- uaa%20release
item.description: Cloud Foundry UAA, versions 60 prior to 66.0, contain an authorization logic error. In environments with multiple identity providers that contain accounts across identity providers with the same username, a remote authenticated user with access to one of these accounts may be able to obtain a token for an account of the same username in the other identity provider.

item.title: CVE-2018-11084|2024-08-05T07:54:36.541Z -- cloud%20foundry -- garden-runc
item.description: Cloud Foundry Garden-runC release, versions prior to 1.16.1, prevents deletion of some app environments based on file attributes. A remote authenticated malicious user may create and delete apps with crafted file attributes to cause a denial of service for new app instances or scaling up of existing apps.

item.title: CVE-2018-1264|2024-08-05T03:51:49.038Z -- cloud%20foundry -- log-cache-release
item.description: Cloud Foundry Log Cache, versions prior to 1.1.1, logs its UAA client secret on startup as part of its envstruct report. A remote attacker who has gained access to the Log Cache VM can read this secret, gaining all privileges held by the Log Cache UAA client. In the worst case, if this client is an admin, the attacker would gain complete control over the Foundation.

item.title: CVE-2018-1193|2024-08-05T03:51:48.967Z -- cloud%20foundry -- cloud%20foundry%20router
item.description: Cloud Foundry routing-release, versions prior to 0.175.0, lacks sanitization for user-provided X-Forwarded-Proto headers. A remote user can set the X-Forwarded-Proto header in a request to potentially bypass an application requirement to only respond over secure connections.

item.title: CVE-2018-1268|2024-08-05T03:51:49.182Z -- cloud%20foundry -- loggregator
item.description: Cloud Foundry Loggregator, versions 89.x prior to 89.5 or 96.x prior to 96.1 or 99.x prior to 99.1 or 101.x prior to 101.9 or 102.x prior to 102.2, does not validate app GUID structure in requests. A remote authenticated malicious user knowing the GUID of an app may construct malicious requests to read from or write to the logs of that app.

item.title: CVE-2018-15755|2024-08-05T10:01:54.526Z -- cloud%20foundry -- cf%20networking%20release
item.description: Cloud Foundry CF Networking Release, versions 2.11.0 prior to 2.16.0, contain an internal api endpoint vulnerable to SQL injection between Diego cells and the policy server. A remote authenticated malicious user with mTLS certs can issue arbitrary SQL queries and gain access to the policy server.

item.title: CVE-2018-15796|2024-08-05T10:01:54.596Z -- cloud%20foundry -- bits-service-release
item.description: Cloud Foundry Bits Service Release, versions prior to 2.14.0, uses an insecure hashing algorithm to sign URLs. A remote malicious user may obtain a signed URL and extract the signing key, allowing them complete read and write access to the the Bits Service storage.

item.title: CVE-2018-1223|2024-08-05T03:51:49.007Z -- cloud%20foundry -- container%20runtime
item.description: Cloud Foundry Container Runtime (kubo-release), versions prior to 0.14.0, may leak UAA and vCenter credentials to application logs. A malicious user with the ability to read the application logs could use these credentials to escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2018-11041|2024-08-05T07:54:36.475Z -- cloud%20foundry -- cloud%20foundry%20uaa
item.description: Cloud Foundry UAA, versions later than 4.6.0 and prior to 4.19.0 except 4.10.1 and 4.7.5 and uaa-release versions later than v48 and prior to v60 except v55.1 and v52.9, does not validate redirect URL values on a form parameter used for internal UAA redirects on the login page, allowing open redirects. A remote attacker can craft a malicious link that, when clicked, will redirect users to arbitrary websites after a successful login attempt.

item.title: CVE-2024-37082|2024-08-02T03:43:51.046Z -- cloud%20foundry -- haproxy-boshrelease
item.description:
When deploying Cloud Foundry together with the haproxy-boshrelease and using a non default configuration, it might be possible to craft HTTP requests that bypass mTLS authentication to Cloud Foundry applications.
You are affected if you have route-services enabled in routing-release and have configured the haproxy-boshrelease property “ha_proxy.forwarded_client_cert” to “forward_only_if_route_service”.

item.title: CVE-2024-37082|2024-07-17T20:25:39.258Z -- cloud%20foundry -- haproxy-boshrelease
item.description:
When deploying Cloud Foundry together with the haproxy-boshrelease and using a non default configuration, it might be possible to craft HTTP requests that bypass mTLS authentication to Cloud Foundry applications.
You are affected if you have route-services enabled in routing-release and have configured the haproxy-boshrelease property “ha_proxy.forwarded_client_cert” to “forward_only_if_route_service”.

item.title: CVE-2024-37082|2024-07-12T15:38:05.256Z -- cloud%20foundry -- haproxy-boshrelease
item.description:
When deploying Cloud Foundry together with the haproxy-boshrelease and using a non default configuration, it might be possible to craft HTTP requests that bypass mTLS authentication to Cloud Foundry applications.
You are affected if you have route-services enabled in routing-release and have configured the haproxy-boshrelease property “ha_proxy.forwarded_client_cert” to “forward_only_if_route_service”.

item.title: CVE-2024-22279|2024-06-11T17:23:34.311Z -- cloud%20foundry -- routing%20release
item.description: Improper handling of requests in Routing Release > v0.273.0 and <= v0.297.0 allows an unauthenticated attacker to degrade the service availability of the Cloud Foundry deployment if performed at scale.

item.title: CVE-2024-37082|2024-07-12T16:22:02.363Z -- cloud%20foundry -- haproxy-boshrelease
item.description:
When deploying Cloud Foundry together with the haproxy-boshrelease and using a non default configuration, it might be possible to craft HTTP requests that bypass mTLS authentication to Cloud Foundry applications.
You are affected if you have route-services enabled in routing-release and have configured the haproxy-boshrelease property “ha_proxy.forwarded_client_cert” to “forward_only_if_route_service”.

item.title: CVE-2024-22279|2024-08-01T22:43:34.216Z -- cloud%20foundry -- routing%20release
item.description: Improper handling of requests in Routing Release > v0.273.0 and <= v0.297.0 allows an unauthenticated attacker to degrade the service availability of the Cloud Foundry deployment if performed at scale.
